column4: hi! I'm about to install 9.04 desktop i386 on my quadcore. Is SMP equiavalent to multicore support? i.e., do I need to compile a kernel to take advantage of my quadcore, or will it work out of the box?
quad works out of the box, im running one :D
Boobah said the opposite of you
i dunno. I have an intel core 2 quad and it's running just fine
does top show two cores, or how do you monitor that?
gnome system monitor shows all 4 cores... for instance, 1 is a 8% 2 is at 2.8% 3 is a 2 % and 4 is at 7% for me right now
any idea why Boohbah says I need SMP?
you have to ask him about that
it might be that ubuntu auto installs smp, in which case he would be right
just as i suspected ^_^
I've done no such thing. and I think i believe usser
I believe you guys, but why do the official docs say it isn't supported ??
can't answer that one. you could always just try and see what happens ^_^
suppose so :P
what is the difference between what you did and changing /etc/apt/sources.list?
just that i was trying to deviate as little from his path as possible
and I don't know much about where apt sources its sources from
i see. so is there any difference between the two?
ah... k
did you verify the cd after burning? :)
I verified my bootable usb key after creating :p
oops... got your name wrong. meant to say Joushua_Mayer
